Exaggerate: The claim "awards a $25 million bonus" to House members is an exaggeration as there is no provision in the bill for such a bonus.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that nothing in the bill would give any bonus to members of the House or Senate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove the existence of a $25 million bonus for House members.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that there is a specific provision in the bill (Line 17) that awards the bonus, which is a problematic assumption as Line 17 does not mention Congress or House members.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation is that the claim is false and misleading, as it has been debunked by fact-checkers and experts who have found no evidence of a bonus for House members in the bill.
